TopicTitle: [Piano Solo] Orbital Tango in ÃŽâ€�v Major

Articles.Content:
I've had a song idea tumbling in my head for years, waiting for the right rhythm. It came to me while I was docking in KSP: a tango! It sort of all fell together after that.

Orbital Tango in ÃŽâ€v Major (PDF)

A recording of me playing it:

Orbital Tango in ÃŽâ€v Major (Soundcloud)

Orbital Tango in ÃŽâ€v Major (MP3)

Lilypond source, for those interested:

Lilypond source (links to Github)

I was going for whimsical, punctuated with the glorious realization HOLY COW I AM IN SPACE.

More music by me

Soundcloud

Edited September 17, 2013 by The Right Trousers
Frankly, i can't say i like the composition but i admire your ability to compose and your performance.

The ability to play piano has always escaped me. Well done! I like the music indeed. It is very beautiful. Natural piano has such an advantage over digital sequencing that I do. You should post some on Soundcloud if you have not already. Great job!

Never heard of Soundcloud before today, and... it is awesome. I'll try to find the time.

Thanks for the kind words. Now that there are at least 3 composers here, we should lobby for a [Music] tag.

Lovely!

I'm really liking this sudden surge of music threads on the Fan Works. Definitely time for a [Music] tag!

It would be fantastic to have a Music tag. I tire of selecting Special. All art is special, but Music should never be forgotten in any aspects. Easier to search and find more artists. Definitely checkout Soundcloud. It's a great little platform.

Awesome! This sounds like something somebody's bound to put in a video. MIDI?

Edit: Never mind, downloaded Lilypond.

Edited September 14, 2013 by longbyte1

I wish to hear more!

No problem - I just wrote another one. It's like... the more stressful school gets, the more music I write.

Awesome! This sounds like something somebody's bound to put in a video. MIDI?

Edit: Never mind, downloaded Lilypond.

Cool. Running Lilypond on it should output a MIDI file.

I didn't include license text in the music source, but feel free to do whatever you want with it. It'll probably take some work to put any life into the MIDI, though.

This music kinda remands me of studio Ghibli music...

ZodiaK. Anyone Else??

I like it.

At first I thought it's a bit slow for a tango (I dance), but the tempo fits.

I tried singing it as a bolero arrangement, but the bolero is too ... rigid.

The Tango is all about approaching [the lady], missing, demanding the partners attention again, be turned away by her etc..

A thrilling and griping dance. And it fits perfectly as 'docking' music

I think you're right about the tempo. I'm starting to think that three of my Soundcloud recordings (including this one) are too slow, but I didn't think so when I first uploaded them. Maybe I need to let them cool for a week before I share them.

EDIT: Wait, you dance and sing? This place is full of such interesting people!

Edited November 6, 2013 by The Right Trousers

*COUGH* Sorry, no I don't 'sing', but I can I can hum/sing a melody to 'try it out' in different styles.

I do dance, play percussion and piano though. And I'm a soon graded physicist .
